Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the main anomalies are in Cases 1002 1003 and 1004. Now I need to explain why these are problematic based on P2P best practices. For Case 1002 Issuing a PO without requisition approval This bypasses a critical control. The approval ensures that the purchase is authorized budget is available and complies with policies. Without it theres risk of unauthorized spending. Vendor Invoice Received before requisition approval Similarly processing an invoice without the purchase being approved is problematic. It might lead to paying for unapproved purchases or invoices not linked to any PO increasing fraud risk. Case 1003 Releasing payment before receiving goods or invoice Payment should only occur after goods are received and the invoice is matched to the PO. Paying upfront without goods or invoice verification can result in paying for undelivered items or inflated invoices leading to financial loss. Matching invoice after payment The matching process ensures that the invoice corresponds to the PO and that the goods/services were received. If done after payment discrepancies might not be caught leading to overpayments or missed errors. Case 1004 Receiving goods before issuing PO The PO is the document that authorizes the vendor to deliver goods. Receiving goods without a PO could mean the purchase wasnt authorized leading to unauthorized expenses or goods received without proper documentation. Issuing PO after receiving goods This is a process failure. The PO should be issued before the vendor delivers the goods. If the PO is issued after its a breakdown in the procurement process possibly leading to disputes with the vendor or missing documentation for the received goods. Additionally in Case 1004 after receiving goods they issued the PO which is the wrong sequence. The PO should come before receiving goods. This could result in the PO being a retroactive document which is not standard and could cause issues in accounting and auditing.
